cef09ca6-e29f-4a49-85e0-e871318e96f5.description: Earners of the Astronomer Certification for Apache Airflow Fundamentals can demonstrate the fundamental skills needed to create, manage and monitor DAGs on Apache Airflow effectively. This includes understanding the airflow components and the task lifecycle, interacting and choosing the correct view on the UI to monitor and debug tasks, and creating a data pipeline following best practices while making accurate decisions on basic architecture needs.
cef09ca6-e29f-4a49-85e0-e871318e96f5.name: Astronomer Certification for Apache Airflow Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: To pass the Astronomer Certification for Apache Airflow Fundamentals, you have to show your capabilities of understanding the different architecture's components of Airflow, the task life cycle and how the scheduling process works. You should be comfortable recommending use cases, architecture needs, settings and design choices for data pipelines. You should be able to trigger, debug and retry tasks and look at the right views from the UI to monitor them.

04ad184c-fc40-4887-b6d9-d4db73d76f0c.description: Earners of the Astronomer Certification for DAG Authoring in Apache Airflow can demonstrate the skills needed to effectively create reliable and powerful DAGs following best practices on Apache Airflow. This includes choosing the right operators according to the needs, defining task argument's values wisely, knowing what feature to use and its limitations, making right decisions on DAG design. Earners are able to successfully use Airflow daily.
04ad184c-fc40-4887-b6d9-d4db73d76f0c.name: Astronomer Certification DAG Authoring for Apache Airflow

badge_template_activities.title: To pass the Astronomer Certification DAG Authoring for Apache Airflow, you have to show your capabilities of understanding the different features that Airflow brings to create DAGs. What are the pros and cons of each as well as the limitations. You should be comfortable recommending settings and design choices for data pipelines according to different use cases. You should know the most common operators as well as the specificities of other operators allowing to create DAG dependencies and so on
